official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to make anthrax vaccines and antimicrobials available to emergency response providers, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Anthrax vaccination program for first responders

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title V of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall make available surplus vaccines and antimicrobials and vaccines and antimicrobials with short shelf lives, from the strategic national stockpile under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: For the purpose of domestic preparedness for and collective response to terrorism, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to emergency response providers for administration to such providers who voluntarily consent to such administration, and shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 319F–2(a) of the Public Health Service Act

header.#text: Vaccination program for first emergency response providers

text.#text: establish any necessary logistical and tracking systems to facilitate making such vaccines and antimicrobials so available; and
distribute disclosures regarding associated risks to end users.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Under Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis

text.#text: support homeland security-focused risk analysis and risk assessments of the threats posed by anthrax from an act of terror;

leverage existing and emerging homeland security intelligence capabilities and structures to enhance prevention, protection, response, and recovery efforts with respect to an anthrax terror attack; and
share information and provide tailored analytical support on threats posed by anthrax to State, local, and tribal authorities, as well as other national biosecurity and biodefense stakeholders.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting at the end of the items relating to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 526(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct an 18-month pilot program to administer vaccines and antimicrobials to emergency response providers as so authorized.

text.#text: In carrying out the vaccination program authorized in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select emergency response providers based in at least two States for participation in the pilot program.

text.#text: In carrying out the pilot program under this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide to each emergency response provider who participates in the pilot program under this subsection disclosures and educational materials regarding the associated risks of any vaccine or antimicrobial administered under the pilot program and of exposure to anthrax.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the results of the pilot program. The report shall include a plan under which the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: plans to continue to make vaccines and antimicrobials available to emergency response providers under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 526(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the completion of the pilot program under this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall begin implementing the pilot program under this subsection by not later than the date that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
